item.title: Making Scatterplots in R
item.description: A scatterplot is a graph in which the values of two variables are plotted along the two axes. This type of graphic is very important when looking for correlations between variables. Letâ€™s begin by loading that packages that we will need. For this example we will be using the Lahman database which contains baseball statistics going back over 100 years. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggiraph) library(ggplot2) In this scatterplot we are going to compare the number of career homeruns hit to the number of strikeouts.
